title: Chilcotin - Mark (Print)
description: Illustrated Chilcotin translation of the Gospel of Mark. Chilcotin is a Northern Athabaskan language spoken in British Columbia by the Tsilhqot’in people. The name Chilcotin is derived from the Chilcotin name for themselves: Tŝilhqot’in, literally "people of the red ochre river."

language.name: Chilcotin
language.area: South central British Columbia, west of Williams Lake. 7 reserve communities: Alexandria, Toosey, Anahim, Stone, Nemiah, Redstone, Ulkatcho.
